conclusion: Analyze given information and properties of ideal gas to determine molecular collisions from C to D.
A→B is an isothermal process with constant temperature.
B→C is an isochoric process with constant volume.
Pressure decreases from C to D; Volume decreases from C to D.
Pressure is proportional to molecular collisions per unit area per unit time.
Pressure \( p \) is expressed as \( p = \frac{N}{V} \cdot \bar{F} \).
From C to D, pressure \( p \) decreases; volume \( V \) decreases.
Ratio \( \frac{p_C}{V_C} > \frac{p_D}{V_D} \) indicates product \( \frac{p}{V} \) decreases from C to D.
Number of molecules colliding with the unit area of the wall per unit time decreases from C to D.
